intro: Chilochloa annua, commonly known as the annual chilochloa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically green to brown in color. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
